Merge: db759fd7 43e18e66

Date:   Sun Apr 16 20:05:20 2023 +0200

    Merge pull request #2678 from nscuro/fix-trx-has-already-started-exception
    
    Fix potential `Invalid state. Transaction has already started` in `RepositoryMetaAnalyzerTask`

commit 43e18e669bf5cb452520dacba701378b34db8f5f
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sun Apr 16 17:53:52 2023 +0200

    Fix potential `Invalid state. Transaction has already started` in `RepositoryMetaAnalyzerTask`
    
    The task works in such a way that a single `QueryManager` (and thus DN `ExecutionContext` and associated transaction) is shared across analyses of multiple components. Failure to analyze one component does not abort the overall analysis for all components.
    
    Due to missing transaction rollbacks, the `RepositoryMetaAnalyzerTask` could end up in a situation where the `QueryManager`s active transaction failed to commit for one component, such that persisting of results for all following components would fail with `NucleusTransactionException: Invalid state. Transaction has already started`.
    
    This fix is a mere workaround for the missing rollback of the `persist` method. https://github.com/DependencyTrack/dependency-track/issues/2677 has been raised to address this for the entire application.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

17	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/persistence/QueryManager.java
3	3	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/repositories/RepositoryMetaAnalyzerTask.java

commit 87fa9910e084d19e9f3f5b9c15e5a2452dd7a49b
Author: Valentijn Scholten <valentijnscholten@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Apr 16 09:59:20 2023 +0200

    Policy Evaluator: add null check to versionMatches
    
    Signed-off-by: Valentijn Scholten <valentijnscholten@gmail.com>

3	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/policy/CoordinatesPolicyEvaluator.java

16	11	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/nvd/NvdParser.java

commit 18d98171da1654ec36cb5bfe2ecb5ebcad8e5dd3
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 1 14:25:58 2023 +0100

    Use Jackson streaming API to parse NVD feeds
    
    Parsing >100mb JSON files all in one go is consuming too much heap that can't be cleaned up quickly. With Jackson streaming we only keep in memory what we're currently processing.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

170	143	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/nvd/NvdParser.java

Date:   Mon Apr 10 19:32:54 2023 +0200

    Fix migration of Jira config property group name
    
    Upgrades are executed before ConfigProperty defaults are populated. The current upgrade logic attempts to `UPDATE` properties that don't exist yet when the upgrade is executed.
    
    Tested on H2, Postgres 14, and MSSQL 2022

Author: rbt-mm <113189967+rbt-mm@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 22 20:11:36 2023 +0100

    Add `BOM_PROCESSING_FAILED` notification (#2600)
    
    * Add BOM_PROCESSING_FAILED notification
    
    A new notification is sent if the notification rule includes the
    notification group BOM_PROCESSING_FAILED and if an error happens during
    the upload of a BOM.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
    
    * Add project url and exception to new notification
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
    
    * Add BOM format and specVersion
    
    Detach `bomProcessingFailedProject`
    
    Rename `exception` to `cause`
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
    
    ---------
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

commit 64e0f9987efae95f2fcf7547e030db160686ff19
Merge: 25c265a3 b7141e2b
Author: Niklas <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 2 20:59:26 2023 +0000

    Merge pull request #2525 from nscuro/disable-l2-cache-for-mirroring-tasks
    
    Disable DataNucleus L2 cache for mirroring tasks

commit b7141e2b91082b30f5ebf7f81f1031400bed8fc7
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 18:19:48 2023 +0100

    Disable DataNucleus L2 cache for mirroring tasks
    
    Objects that are persisted (created, updated) are put into DN's second level cache. Per default, the cache keeps soft references to objects.
    
    https://www.datanucleus.org/products/accessplatform_6_0/jdo/persistence.html#cache_level2
    
    While this kind of cache may be beneficial for BAU operations, it is totally overkill for our mirroring tasks. Over the course of mirroring the NVD for the first time alone, the cache will grow to over 2 million objects. The majority of those objects will never be accessed again, especially not soon enough for the cache to be of any use.
    
    Soft references can potentially stay for a long time, and thus may inflate heap utilization.
    
    There is a bug in DN that caused NPEs in `Vulnerability#setCwes` on newly created `Vulnerability` objects when L2 cache is disabled. The DN-internal method `dnGetcwes` would return `null`, despite the `cwes` field being initialized with `new ArrayList<>()` one line before. Not sure why this happens, but it can be prevented by setting the `cwes` field to a fully initialized list.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

6	6	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/model/Vulnerability.java
1	1	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/epss/EpssParser.java
1	1	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/nvd/NvdParser.java
17	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/persistence/QueryManager.java
1	1	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/GitHubAdvisoryMirrorTask.java
1	1	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/OsvDownloadTask.java

Author: Anton <Hunroll16@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 1 18:23:07 2023 +0200

    Extend POST /api/v1/bom (uploadBom) to select ParentProject for autocreated projects.
    
    Added 3 params:
    parentName, parentVersion, parentUUID.
    
    If parentUUID is specified, it is used to find parent project and attach it to newly created one. If not, parentName and parentVersion are used.
    If parentUUID or parentName were specified but such project does not exist, 404 is returned.

commit 3ccd28fae912971d4c063c640f07ce7f3cf14595
Merge: 33f3fdc7 3c12a42d

commit 3c12a42d776ae58ed51241a0b5868e05ae011bd0
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 23:19:59 2023 +0100

    Fix NPE when computing enabled OSV ecosystems
    
    When no ecosystems have been enabled yet (i.e. when DT was launched for the first time), the `google.osv.enabled` config property is not set (thus `null`).
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

10	9	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/OsvDownloadTask.java

commit 6ef49a8c2f251888e94c4eb0e1b39c8e7e9c8b0e
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 18:27:23 2023 +0100

    Execute `NistMirrorTask` and `EpssMirrorTask` on multi-threaded event service
    
    Because `IndexTask` also runs on `SingleThreadedEventService`, `IndexEvent`s queue up in the hundreds of thousands until the `NistMirrorTask` completes. As every `IndexEvent` may additionally contain objects of type `Project`, `Component`, `Vulnerability`, etc., keeping so many events in memory has a noticeable impact on heap utilization.
    
    `IndexTask` *must* run on the single-threaded event service, as it's operations are spread across multiple events (create -> update -> commit), and they must be executed in sequence.
    
    For NVD and EPSS mirroring however, they can be executed on the multi-threaded event service by making their respective events `SingletonCapableEvent`s.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

11	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/event/EpssMirrorEvent.java
4	4	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/event/EventSubsystemInitializer.java
11	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/event/NistMirrorEvent.java

Date:   Fri Jan 27 22:46:46 2023 +0100

    Fix upper bound year for NistMirrorTask
    
    Instead of initializing the end year variable when the NistMirrorTask class is loaded (at application startup), initialize it when the class is instantiated (whenever a NistMirrorEvent is emitted).
    
    Fixes #2349

Date:   Fri Dec 16 18:17:25 2022 +0100

    Improve focusing on components in dependency graph (#2296)
    
    * Improve `getDependencyGraphForComponent`
    
    The components needed for pre-expanding the dependency graph in the
    frontend are now being de-duplicated for the API response, drastically
    reducing the amount of data which is sent for a pre-expanded graph.

commit 537ba7da12168d417de37d017666d977d057b289
Author: Niklas <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 15 10:29:32 2022 +0100

    Merge generated BOM with services BOM (#2175)
    
    * Merge generated BOM with services BOM
    
    This operation required the CycloneDX CLI to be installed and is thus disabled by default. The path to the CLI is customizable using the `cyclonedx-cli.path` property.
    
    Also discontinue distribution of BOM in XML format. Maintaining the BOM in multiple formats only adds overhead.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * Add services BOM entries for OSV and Snyk
    
    Closes #2125

commit 787a5be3547a7ddb479aaf678c1f34bf40056426
Author: rbt-mm <113189967+rbt-mm@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 14 17:42:39 2022 +0100

    Workaround for deleting duplicate components when uploading a new BOM (#2278)
    
    * Workaround for deleting duplicate components
    
    When uploading a new BOM to a project with duplicated components, the
    `BomUploadProcessingTask` might throw exceptions while trying to
    recursively delete the old components, resulting in a failed upload,
    where the components from the new BOM are added, but not all old
    components are deleted.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
    
    * Add Logger warning when catching exception
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

    Focus on components in dependency graph and hide other nodes (#2189)

    needed to display a dependency graph that is expanded to every
    occurrence of a specified component.

    are needed to correctly display and expand the resulting dependency
    graph.

commit 3536ad7cccf4da27353eb4e0a3f5a3f16f23366a
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 4 18:52:31 2022 +0100

    Do not create connection pools for upgrades
    
    By creating a temporary PMF based on the same properties as the `PersistenceFactoryInitializer`, the `UpgradeInitializer` would create *two* connection pools of `10` (per default) connections each, for the duration of its execution.
    
    Because upgrades are executed in serial, connection pooling is not beneficial. Creating temporary connection pools is a wasteful operation and should be avoided.
    
    Partially addresses #1935
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

46	20	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/upgrade/UpgradeInitializer.java

commit 27da7c1002306c42963c7a93e1380aa17b98038e
Author: awegg <49698105+awegg@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 30 10:29:27 2022 +0100

    1182: Add support for License URL (#1977)
    
    * 1182: Add support for License URL
    
    Licenses may come with an URL as specified in:
    https://cyclonedx.org/docs/1.4/xml/#type_licenseType
    This is especially useful if there is no license ID given and the URL
    is often a good indicator to manually assign a license in the UI.
    
    Discussion in DependencyTrack/dependency-track#1182
    Related Backend PR: DependencyTrack/dependency-track#1977
    
    Signed-off-by: awegg <alexander@weggerle.de>

    * add reportedBy and updatedAt in vulnerable software

    * fix performance by making field transient
    
    Signed-off-by: Sahiba Mittal <sahibamittal98@gmail.com>
    
    * Preliminary work to handle multiple sources reporting affected versions for the same vulnerability
    
    Previously, GitHub was blunty overriding any VulnerableSoftware<->Vulnerability relationships established by OSV, while OSV would just append on what's already there.
    
    Using attributions for these relationships, this issue is now solved. The performance impact so far has been minimal, although no real benchmarks have been made.
    
    Tests are still a WIP and will be added in a later commit.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

    * Handle old VulnerableSoftware records without attribution
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * Fix redundant `persist(vsList)` calls in `NvdParser`
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * Add index to improve attribution lookups
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * OSV: Treat `versionStartIncluding=0` as `null`
    
    This is consistent with how other sources do it, and avoids duplicate `VulnerableSoftware` records that end up meaning the same thing.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * Fix VulnerabilityResourceTest, add test case for deletion
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
    
    * Use `getObjectByUuid` instead of `getObjectById`
    
    Because the latter throws an exception instead of returning `null` when the object was not found.

commit f97034cb8307e99ba38cc6e883aa8b6225787725
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 13 15:28:07 2022 +0200

    Ensure that policy is part of policy violations API response
    
    DataNucleus would (in some, not all cases) falsely assume that the `violation.policyCondition.policy` field has already been loaded, and would not attempt to fetch it again. This then caused API responses to not contain the `policy` field (#2043).
    
    The scenario is not reproducible in unit tests, even with regular cache eviction. It is reliably reproducible in running instances using the steps listed in #2043 though.
    
    Instead of detachment like it's introduced in this PR, another cheap fix would've been to call `violation.getPolicyCondition().getPolicy().getName()` instead of `violation.getPolicyCondition().getPolicy()` in `PolicyQueryManager#getPolicyViolations`. That would force DN to fetch all fields of `Policy`, but I felt like that was too hacky to rely on it.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

32	0	docs/_posts/2022-10-13-v4.6.1.md
31	3	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/resources/v1/PolicyViolationResource.java
13	0	src/test/java/org/dependencytrack/resources/v1/PolicyViolationResourceTest.java

commit 98fae147660714d8cd5f23fa8d990e1ee9dbabf6
Author: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 28 17:03:56 2022 +0200

    Include children of selected project in alert
    
    Currently, when creating a limited alert rule you need to select every
    single version of a project. This does not work well for projects which
    create new versions regularly.
    By automatically subscribing every child of a project to a notification
    rule, it is simpler to limit all existing or every future version of a
    project to a notification rule.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

    - Optimized several conditional clauses which check if a project is
    active

    inactive or if a project updates itself to its parent

    - Updated API calls to reduce redundant methods and to filter a
    project's viable parents in the backend instead of in the backend

commit 176ac0d41e77ec49e17ef42d469d4cf28daa7164
Author: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 14 10:54:00 2022 +0200

    Allow teams as recipients for notification rules
    
    Not having to manually insert every single email address into the
    notification rule destination simplifies the management of
    notification recipients and allows dynamic email destinations by
    subscribing and reorganizing teams.
    
    Add new M:N-relationship from `NotificationRule` to `Team` which
    represents a team subscribing to an alert.
    
    Add API calls to notification rule which subscribes or unsubscribes a
    team from an alert with an email publisher.
    
    Parse mail destination by adding every email address of a team member
    and/or by adding the email addresses from the destination input form.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

15	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/model/NotificationRule.java
12	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/notification/NotificationRouter.java
54	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/notification/publisher/SendMailPublisher.java
13	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/persistence/NotificationQueryManager.java
4	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/persistence/QueryManager.java

commit e9335226dc74476a92283378463f5231a4147a76
Author: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 15 15:15:59 2022 +0200

    Decode whitespace in file path by `.getResource()`
    
    Converts the returned URL from `.getResource()` to a URI to decode
    escaped whitespace, and by that enables whitespace in a file path.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

commit 08679ca28d5786176ff7a1778fbe9de71b30234a
Author: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 14 16:31:39 2022 +0200

    Add affected project in email subject
    
    Shows the affected project in the subject line of an email notification
    to make the emails more distinguishable and to make it easier for a user
    to gather important information like project name and version quickly.
    
    Changes the default email template for the notification groups
    'NEW_VULNERABILITY_IDENTIFIED' and 'PROJECT_AUDIT_CHANGE' to list the
    project of the affected component and to list other projects, if these
    are also affected.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

commit 8525085c014f4274ad067a2731a04ce1698d659a
Author: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 13 17:52:41 2022 +0200

    Add name of affected project in mail subject
    
    Currently, it's hard to tell from an email notification which projects are affected by a new-found vulnerability because the subject line is always the same and the body does not show any of the affected projects.
    This change adds either the name of the affected project or the tag "on multiple projects" to the subject of an email notification.
    It also changes the default Pebble-Template for emails to show every affected project in the notification body.
    
    Signed-off-by: RBickert <rbt@mm-software.com>

commit 26e0adba3dff37f03b8a7c75e964db84fe400708
Author: awegg <alexander@weggerle.de>
Date:   Sun Sep 11 10:02:00 2022 +0200

    Issue 1174: Fix component update due to uppercase hashes
    
    Predefined RegexSequences only validate lower case hash notations.
    While this is usually the case it is not mandatory as hex values can be
    upper and lower case. Furthermore, tools like cyclonedx-dotnet provide
    uppercase hash values and boms generated by it can be imported but
    components can't be changed in UI. API will return an error for failed
    hash validation
    
    Signed-off-by: awegg <alexander@weggerle.de>

16	16	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/model/Component.java
34	0	src/test/java/org/dependencytrack/resources/v1/ComponentResourceTest.java

commit 8d7467d7f09df876e78fcfb11653b2cef34a5fd1
Merge: 024698f9 d469ab6c
Author: Niklas <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Jul 23 21:31:37 2022 +0200

    Merge pull request #1813 from nscuro/omtimize-single-result-queries
    
    Use datastore-native limiting in queries where only a single result is desired

commit d469ab6cfe214066a07139b1cb1a6e9771e99c1a
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Jul 23 20:29:51 2022 +0200

    Use datastore-native limiting in queries where only a single result is desired
    
    Translates into `LIMIT 1`, `TOP 1` etc. depending on the datastore.
    
    Results in queries being executed faster in the datastore (at least when no index is used), reduces the amount of unnecessary data being loaded into RAM.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

commit c6c687e1b102f4cae6678dbc726c2e7e7474774f
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jul 3 19:30:39 2022 +0200

    Fetch `Vulnerability#vulnerableSoftware` lazily
    
    For some odd reason, the query generated by DataNucleus for fetching `VulnerableSoftware` is drastically less efficient when using the `VULNERABLESOFTWARE` `@FetchGroup` over lazy fetching via `Vulnerability#getVulnerableSoftware()`.
    
    Query generated by fetch group:
    
    ```
    SELECT 'org.dependencytrack.model.VulnerableSoftware' AS DN_TYPE,A1.CPE22,A1.CPE23,A1.EDITION,A1.ID AS NUCORDER0,A1."LANGUAGE",A1.OTHER,A1.PART,A1.PRODUCT,A1.PURL,A1.PURL_NAME,A1.PURL_NAMESPACE,A1.PURL_QUALIFIERS,A1.PURL_SUBPATH,A1.PURL_TYPE,A1.PURL_VERSION,A1.SWEDITION,A1.TARGETHW,A1.TARGETSW,A1."UPDATE",A1.UUID,A1.VENDOR,A1.VERSION,A1.VERSIONENDEXCLUDING,A1.VERSIONENDINCLUDING,A1.VERSIONSTARTEXCLUDING,A1.VERSIONSTARTINCLUDING,A1.VULNERABLE,A0.VULNERABILITY_ID FROM VULNERABLESOFTWARE_VULNERABILITIES A0 INNER JOIN VULNERABLESOFTWARE A1 ON A0.VULNERABLESOFTWARE_ID = A1.ID WHERE EXISTS (SELECT 'org.dependencytrack.model.Vulnerability' AS DN_TYPE,A0_SUB.ID AS DN_APPID FROM VULNERABILITY A0_SUB WHERE A0_SUB.SOURCE = 'NVD' AND A0_SUB.VULNID = 'CVE-2020-0404' AND A0.VULNERABILITY_ID = A0_SUB.ID) ORDER BY NUCORDER0
    ```
    
    Query generated by `getVulnerableSoftware()`:
    
    ```
    SELECT 'org.dependencytrack.model.VulnerableSoftware' AS DN_TYPE,A1.CPE22,A1.CPE23,A1.EDITION,A1.ID AS NUCORDER0,A1."LANGUAGE",A1.OTHER,A1.PART,A1.PRODUCT,A1.PURL,A1.PURL_NAME,A1.PURL_NAMESPACE,A1.PURL_QUALIFIERS,A1.PURL_SUBPATH,A1.PURL_TYPE,A1.PURL_VERSION,A1.SWEDITION,A1.TARGETHW,A1.TARGETSW,A1."UPDATE",A1.UUID,A1.VENDOR,A1.VERSION,A1.VERSIONENDEXCLUDING,A1.VERSIONENDINCLUDING,A1.VERSIONSTARTEXCLUDING,A1.VERSIONSTARTINCLUDING,A1.VULNERABLE FROM VULNERABLESOFTWARE_VULNERABILITIES A0 INNER JOIN VULNERABLESOFTWARE A1 ON A0.VULNERABLESOFTWARE_ID = A1.ID WHERE A0.VULNERABILITY_ID = ? ORDER BY NUCORDER0
    ```
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

2	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/OsvDownloadTask.java

commit 9cfcf190afea4acf50af1a45afdef14b22030a59
Merge: a3ea90eb 815f6164
Author: Niklas <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 22 20:32:36 2022 +0200

    Merge pull request #1742 from officerNordberg/bugfix/notification-level
    
    flips level logic to mirror root logger

commit 815f61645ae175f6005907c16e52e7093fe933c8
Author: Drew Thompson <drew.michael.thompson+ghdco@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 22 10:43:07 2022 -0500

    flips level logic to mirror root logger
    * An INFORMATIONAL sink/publisher will receive INFO, WARN, ERROR events
    * A WARNING sink/publisher will receive WARN, ERROR events
    * An ERROR sink/publisher will receive ERROR events
    
    This creates the ablitity to publish mirror events only when in error as
    opposed the the current "everything is okay" alarms we now get daily on ERROR scoped
    Alerts.
    
    Signed-off-by: Drew Thompson <drew.michael.thompson+ghdco@gmail.com>

3	3	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/notification/NotificationRouter.java

commit c8abaa3401e37ac207e776f79657a95dccdb8ce9
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat May 28 16:16:36 2022 +0200

    Use bot account to create releases
    
    Builds upon https://github.com/DependencyTrack/dependency-track/pull/1645. `Publish CI` is not triggered automatically when creating releases with `GITHUB_TOKEN`. The bot account needs write access to the repository. The bot's PAT (`BOT_RELEASE_TOKEN`) only requires the `public_repo` scope.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

1	2	.github/workflows/ci-publish.yaml

Merge: 6f3b4ab9 9e0d9513

commit 9e0d95130c8fa0f456e5fcf880dc850b306e541a
Author: Tonimir Kisasondi <kisasondi@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 12 13:25:43 2022 +0200

    Documentation fix for export endpoint permissions
    
    If you want to export the FPF format findings via the `/api/v1/finding/project/{uuid}/export` API, the documentation says that you need the VULNERABILITY_ANALYSIS permission for the accompanying API key. After some debugging, i found out that the source requires VIEW_VULNERABILITY:
    
    https://github.com/DependencyTrack/dependency-track/blob/beda0ce2a594302b6ef976187967b0c4ea12cd91/src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/resources/v1/FindingResource.java#L111
    
    This is a fix to patch the documentation to state the correct permissions needed.
    
    Signed-off-by: Tonimir Kisasondi <kisasondi@gmail.com>

commit 6637fe2b9d7b892927702b5d941129196f507ddf
Merge: d2a61526 735eca46
Author: Niklas <nscuro@protonmail.com>

    Add PATCH method to the project resource for partially updating an existing project

commit 735eca4688bb99cec9b8243df792947ca69ed211
Author: Ronny Perinke <23166289+sephiroth-j@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Sat May 7 17:51:15 2022 +0200

    Add PATCH method to the project resource for partially updating an existing project
    This eases project management by removing the need to fetch a project at first, modifying the parts of interest and updating the project in total.
    For example , it is now possible to change the `active` property from `true` to `false` without touching other properties.
    
    Signed-off-by: Ronny Perinke <23166289+sephiroth-j@users.noreply.github.com>

commit b3ebbed9dfee20355e9b5c4c1f3141f191173a13
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 30 13:30:48 2022 +0200

    Mark AnalysisResourceTest and ViolationAnalysisResourceTest as not thread safe
    
    Just in case tests will ever be run in parallel. See https://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-failsafe-plugin/examples/fork-options-and-parallel-execution.html#
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

commit 5656d4fb95d4f7470785ee1db67cb87b98a22237
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 29 23:15:39 2022 +0200

    Fix flaky AnalysisResource and ViolationAnalysisResource tests
    
    The tests assert the existence of notifications, which are sent asynchronously by DT's event system. While locally this happens fast enough, it seems like it's delayed when executed in CI, causing test failures.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

commit f3af574108d544359bc9d655d2a1d2855e855236
Merge: ad371d88 d3e7f262
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Sun Apr 10 14:48:06 2022 -0500

    Merge pull request #1530 from nscuro/metrics-update-tests
    
    Add tests for `MetricsUpdateTask` and squash some bugs along the way

commit d3e7f262fd14d580d2ace10a42c7f75792811259
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Apr 9 19:09:52 2022 +0200

    Add tests for MetricsUpdateTask; Fix bugs along the way
    
    * The count of audited and suppressed findings was off, as their queries still included `project == null` expressions. Probably leftovers from the global component model before v4.
    * The count of audited findings was off, because it didn't account for suppressed findings. If a finding is suppressed, the overall finding count is reduced as well. Until now however, suppressed findings were considered "audited" as well, which could result in situations where more findings are audited than even exist.
    * The audited/unaudited counts of policy violations were off, because the count of audited violations was never populated.
    * Suppressed policy violations were not reflected in the metrics.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

commit 29d142b11ba5c39483ff1a2a8a30c4becf2c4b14
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 19 23:01:01 2022 +0100

    Only update inherited risk score for projects and components when it actually changed.
    
    Especially for components, this is the most common scenario. By not performing this operation when nothing changed, we're saving unnecessary transactions and persist->refresh cycles.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

24	16	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/MetricsUpdateTask.java

commit 6af8b47e60cc12a573d368238896b5a0c965b5f4
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Sat Mar 19 21:24:29 2022 +0100

    Use a new `QueryManager` for each project within a portfolio metrics update run
    
    This ensures that the L1 and L2 cache of the DN persistence manager are regularly cleared and other related resources are released.
    
    Profiling indicates that this cuts the amount of object allocations roughly in half. CPU time spent on cache maintenance is also drastically reduced.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

5	3	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/MetricsUpdateTask.java

commit 3027b6b5973a6aeed1b5a59449208c2436c9db3b
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 18 11:27:32 2022 +0100

    Fix container image health check
    
    `wget` does not come preinstalled on Debian slim. Additionally, the syntax of disabling proxies differs from the `wget` provided by Alpine vs. Debian.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

commit 8bf4664dfdb090626ce31e4abc267a82d3ce0b81
Author: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 18 09:37:00 2022 +0100

    Fix v440Updater for MSSQL
    
    The `NAME` column of the `PERMISSION` table has a `UNIQUE` constraint, using `TOP` or `LIMIT` is thus not necessary to get only a single result.
    
    Signed-off-by: nscuro <nscuro@protonmail.com>

32	0	docs/_posts/2022-xx-xx-v4.4.1.md
1	1	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/upgrade/v440/v440Updater.java

commit 9ebea7430aecf95bb0d3f06600cf72af96b86ade
Merge: 4c4533b8 78d856e2
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Thu Jan 20 13:13:39 2022 -0600

    Merge pull request #1341 from sephiroth-j/bugfix/no-classifier-for-autocreated-projects
    
    fix: during BOM upload auto-created projects do not have a classifier

commit 78d856e2825c27b37fc504b30d1c258259e15b65
Author: Ronny Perinke <23166289+sephiroth-j@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 20 19:59:37 2022 +0100

    fix: during BOM upload auto-created projects do not have a classifier
    For manually created projects or when updating a project, a classifier is required and set to the default value "APPLICATION".
    However, when creating a project as part of the BOM upload, the classifier is not set.
    This fix reads the classifier from the BOM and updates the project as needed. If no classifier is specified in the BOM (old version), the default "APPLICATION" is used.
    
    Signed-off-by: Ronny Perinke <23166289+sephiroth-j@users.noreply.github.com>

11	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/BomUploadProcessingTask.java
52	0	src/test/java/org/dependencytrack/task/BomUploadProcessingTaskTest.java

    #593 - Added support for caching of vulnerability analysis results. Without a global component model, the potential for individual component analysis is exponential. commit 67ed22f2119717a4d34c9957cc24385845874606
Merge: 56c16ade 84a8dd87
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Tue Jan 7 20:49:51 2020 -0600

    Merge pull request #562 from angrylogic/patch-2
    
    Update the CPE field on components from BOM

commit 84a8dd871de0999d7e752a5f25f490403d81a13c
Author: angrylogic <angrylogic@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 7 15:24:59 2020 -0500

    Update the CPE field on components from BOM
    
    When an existing component is detected whilst processing a BOM most fields are updated to reflect the latest value from the BOM.  The `Cpe` field appears to be missing from this list.  This makes it difficult to update the `Cpe` and thus match against NVD vulnerabilities.
    
    This patch adds the Cve field to the list updated from the BOM.

1	0	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/tasks/BomUploadProcessingTask.java

commit b1ece7e1a54e35113ee855536610a3f9f6220eff
Merge: 180792cb e7f81269
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Wed Jun 19 09:42:53 2019 -0500

    Merge pull request #375 from angrylogic/master
    
    Parse latest date format from dependency-check XML reports

commit e7f81269ebb37e80f75a7086751754c464095902
Author: Greg Harris <gharris@angrylogic.net>
Date:   Tue Jun 18 14:33:34 2019 -0400

    Handle latest date format from dependency-check.
    
    At some point Dependency Check moved to using
    DateTimeFormatter.ISO_INSTANT to generate the scan date inside the XML
    report.  This format reports dates in UTC without a timezone and causes
    Dependnecy Track to fail to parse these reports (and thus throw a NPE
    when one is ingested via the API).
    
    See:
    https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/blob/55d8f6659746e71b00f1f480d683b9660a5679d7/core/src/main/java/org/owasp/dependencycheck/reporting/ReportGenerator.java#L204
    
    This patch updates the date parsing code so taht both the old and new
    formats are tried.  It should allow Dependency Track to parse reports
    from both versions.

16	2	src/main/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/dependencycheck/model/DateAdapter.java
43	0	src/test/java/org/dependencytrack/parser/dependencycheck/model/DateAdapterTest.java

commit f6ddb2ac793e44c476f123de2ed56264ba6a1660
Author: angrylogic <angrylogic@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 6 15:04:37 2019 -0400

    Fetch JDBC drivers over HTTPS
    
    This change updates the Dockerfile so that the JDBC drivers are fetched over a secure channel via HTTPS.  This prevents a MITM attack against these dependencies which might result in a compromised docker container.

commit acf3bffb6361387160b8ca564d2e2167f8768ef2
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Wed Apr 11 23:42:55 2018 -0500

    Making license not use L2 cache when used in context with a Component object. Strange behavior in that the License would occassionally (most of the time) be returned as a soft reference but without being fully populated. Not caching the license and forcing it to be queried on appears to solve the issue.

commit 108f21ccd19764af4bc64bc7cd6ef402e6dca6c7
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Thu Feb 22 23:50:49 2018 -0600

    Added optional support for a dependency-check global properties file. This feature is designed to provide specific dependency-check configuration overrides (from default). It is NOT intended to be a duplicate copy of the dependency-check.properties. Improper use of this feature will likely result in dependency-check analysis being completely inoperatable. Use with caution. Fixes #55

8	0	src/main/java/org/owasp/dependencytrack/tasks/DependencyCheckTask.java

Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Thu Feb 22 23:31:57 2018 -0600

    Fixed pagination issue in 3.0 master branch that resulted in inconsistent results when paginating through multiple sets of results. This resulted in some pages containing duplicates and omissions of some data altogether.
    
    The issue reported against v1.0 may or may not have been the same issue. v3 is based on entirely different code, different persistence framework and logic, and a different data model.
    
    Interesting that v3 had similar symptoms.
    
    Fix: ensure all paginated results have a default ordering set.
    
    Closes #60

3	0	src/main/java/org/owasp/dependencytrack/persistence/QueryManager.java

commit 5c842161e3d9aefc0a86216cb589ec9d9fae3a10
Author: Steve Springett <steve@springett.us>
Date:   Thu Feb 22 21:56:23 2018 -0600

    Originally autoupdate was programatically disabled and set to false on all scans when ODT only supported retrieving feeds from the NVD. Now that ODT has an internal mirror of the NVD and ODC uses that mirror, enabling autoupdate is preferred and necessary if the data directory needs to be populated (as was the case with #95). The analysis failed, ODT assumed it would be successful, and tried to read a report that didn't exist. Also, changed the initial startup delay for executing independent ODC scans.

4	2	src/main/java/org/owasp/dependencytrack/tasks/TaskScheduler.java
